main event: A pilot reported a sighting of a brilliant white object resembling a strong spotlight while flying a T-33 aircraft near Paine Field, Washington.
interesting points: The object was the size of a basketball and illuminated the sky as if from an explosion., The sighting lasted approximately 5 seconds with no sound heard during the event., The object seemed to gain altitude before disappearing upward., The pilot thought he was about to collide with the object and initiated evasive maneuvers., On January 15, 1961, a meteor event was reported in southern Oregon and northern California after this sighting.
witness description: Lt. W 3 McDonald and Lt. James L. Funk, Jr., both pilots in T-33 aircraft
